body_html:
It looks like the DynamicStitch op is giving an incorrect output in some cases. Can you replace the last part of the program with the following and let us know what the three values are when it crashes?

op = tf.get_default_graph().get_operation_by_name("gradients/Sum_grad/DynamicStitch")
with tf.Session() as sess:
    for input_ in op.inputs:
        print(input_, sess.run(input_, feed_dict={x: Xdata, y: Ydata}))
    print(op.outputs[0], sess.run(op.outputs[0], feed_dict={x: Xdata, y: Ydata}))
    sess.run(tf.global_variables_initializer())
    sess.run(train_op, feed_dict={ x: Xdata, y: Ydata })
    print('done')

body:
It looks like the DynamicStitch op is giving an incorrect output in some cases. Can you replace the last part of the program with the following and let us know what the three values are when it crashes?

```python
op = tf.get_default_graph().get_operation_by_name("gradients/Sum_grad/DynamicStitch")
with tf.Session() as sess:
    for input_ in op.inputs:
        print(input_, sess.run(input_, feed_dict={x: Xdata, y: Ydata}))
    print(op.outputs[0], sess.run(op.outputs[0], feed_dict={x: Xdata, y: Ydata}))
    sess.run(tf.global_variables_initializer())
    sess.run(train_op, feed_dict={ x: Xdata, y: Ydata })
    print('done')
```
